description: This trap indicates that the specified file system has been mounted on the specified node. The event is sent by the mounting node.

event.Summary: $v2 file system has been mounted on Node $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsMountTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE

description: A string that represents the IP address.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: This trap indicates that the specified file system has been unmounted on the specified node. The event is sent by the unmounting node.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsUnmountTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE

description: A string that represents the IP address.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: This trap indicates that the specified disk has been successfully added to the specified file system. The event is sent by the specified node which is the stripe group manager for the file system.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsAddDiskTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskName s EXAMPLE

description: A string that represents the IP address.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: The disk name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskName

description: This trap indicates that the specified disk has been successfully deleted from the specified file system. The event is sent by the specified node which is the stripe group manager for the file system.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsDeleteDiskTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskName s EXAMPLE

description: A string that represents the IP address.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: The disk name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskName

description: This trap indicates that the specified disk has been successfully changed within the specified file system. The event is sent by the specified node which is the stripe group manager for the file system.

event.Summary: $v3 disk successfully changed withing file system $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsChangeDiskTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskName s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskStatus s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskAvailability s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskFailureGroupName s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskMetadata s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskData s EXAMPLE

description: A string that represents the IP address.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: The disk name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskName

description: The status of a disk (values: NotInUse, InUse, Suspended, BeingFormatted, BeingAdded, BeingEmptied, BeingDeleted, BeingDeleted-p, ReferencesBeingRemoved, BeingReplaced or Replacement).
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskStatus

description: The availability of the disk (Unchanged, OK, Unavailable, Recovering).
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskAvailability

description: The disk's failure group name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskFailureGroupName

description: Indicates whether the disk holds metadata.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskMetadata

description: Indicates whether the disk holds data.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiskData

description: This trap indicates that a stripe group manager takeover has been successfully completed for the specified file system. The event is sent by the new stripe group manager.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsSgmgrTakeoverTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsSgmgrIpAddress s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsPrevSgmgrIpAddress s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE

description: The IP address of the stripe group manager.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsSgmgrIpAddress

description: The IP address of the previous stripe group manager.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsPrevSgmgrIpAddress

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: This trap indicates that the specified node has failed. The event is sent by the configuration manager.
A string that represents the IP address.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress

description: This trap indicates that the specified node has recovered normally. The event is sent by the configuration manager.
A string that represents the IP address.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress

description: This trap indicates that the specified file system has been successfully created. The event is sent by the file system's stripe group manager node.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemCreationTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsSgmgrIpAddress s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE

description: The IP address of the stripe group manager.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsSgmgrIpAddress

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: This trap indicates that the specified file system has been successfully deleted. The event is sent by the file system's stripe group manager node.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemDeletionTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsSgmgrIpAddress s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE

description: The IP address of the stripe group manager.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsSgmgrIpAddress

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: This trap indicates that the specified file system has been successfully changed. The event is sent by the file system's stripe group manager node.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemStateChangeTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsUserUnbalanced s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsMetaUnbalanced s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsUserIllReplicated s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsMetaIllReplicated s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsUserExposed s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsMetaExposed s EXAMPLE

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: Can be all, some or none.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsUserUnbalanced

description: Can be all, some or none.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsMetaUnbalanced

description: Can be all, some or none.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsUserIllReplicated

description: Can be all, some or none.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsMetaIllReplicated

description: Can be all, some or none.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsUserExposed

description: Can be all, some or none.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsMetaExposed

description: This trap indicates that a new connection thread has been established between the events exporter and the management application. The event is sent by the collector node.

event.Summary: New connection thread has been established between the events exporter and the management application

description: A string that represents the IP address.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress

description: This trap indicates that the internal event collection buffer in the GPFS daemon has overflowed. The event is sent by the collector node.

event.Summary: Internal event collection buffer in the GPFS daemon has overflowed

description: A string that represents the IP address.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress

description: This trap indicates the token manager status. It is sent every time the performance monitor thread wakes up (approximately 30 seconds).
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsTokenManagerStatusTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsTotalMemoryUsed u 9999 GPFS-MIB::gpfsTotalTmRequestsPerSecond u 9999

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: The percentage of shared segment used by token manager for all stripe groups.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsTotalMemoryUsed

description: The token manager requests per second for all stripe groups.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsTotalTmRequestsPerSecond

description: This trap indicates the presence of a hung thread on the specified node.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsHungThreadTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsWaitTime u 9999 GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiagnosis s EXAMPLE

description: A string that represents the IP address.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsNodeIpAddress

description: The time the hung thread has been waiting.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsWaitTime

description: Shows the number of hung threads and detail on the longest hung thread.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsDiagnosis

description: This trap indicates that utilization of the specified storage pool (within the specified file system) has crossed the threshold. The StgPoolUtil indicates the current utilization of the storage pool as a percentage. The event is sent by the file system's stripe group manager.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD GPFS-MIB::gpfsStgPoolUtilizationTrap GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsStgPoolName s EXAMPLE GPFS-MIB::gpfsStgPoolUtil u 9999

description: The file system name.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsFileSystemName

description: The name of the storage pool.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsStgPoolName

description: The storage pool utilization by unit of percent.
variables.name: GPFS-MIB::gpfsStgPoolUtil
